docs.lead_paragraph: The sudden decease of Col. AMASA PARKER, at his residence in this village, on the 1st inst., in full health and vigor of mind, though at an advanced age, has cast a gloom over this community, and left a void that will not seen be filled. He was born at Washington, Litchfield County, Conn., Oct. 28,1784, and was a graduate of Yale College. attended the Law School at Litehfield, and

headline.main: THE KISSANE TRIAL.; SENTENCE OF THE COURT. AFFECTING SPEECH OF THE PRISONER, Bill Poole and Williams Indicated--Williams Tried. The Grand Jury's Indictment in the Poole Murder. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. Recorder Smith. Yesterday, in this Court, the Recorder commenced proceedings by sentencing Francis McClusky, convicted of burglary in the third degree, to two years in the State Prison. The Recorder had previously sent him to the House of Refuge, but he was returned from thence, as he was supposed to be over the age at which he could be admitted.
docs.abstract: Indicted with Dan Williams, for assault

Prof. REED, of the University of Virginia, was one of the victims of the steamer Arctic's disaster. headline.main: THE STORY OF A CONVENT.; Its Foundation and Labors.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: All the religious world has been lately stirred up by the final settlement, after fifteen centuries of doubts and controversies, of the question concerning the Immaculate Conception of the Virgin Mary; and there is presently a rumor afloat, (whether founded or not, I am unable to affirm.)

docs.lead_paragraph: There was a rumor in Albany yesterday, which our correspondent seems to credit, and which is of some importance if true. It was, in effect, that the appointment of nine, and the disappointment of about three hundred, gentlemen seeking to be Harbor Masters, had been confirmed by the Senate.

headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS; LEGISLATIVE PROCEEDINGS. A Voice from the Maine Law Men in the Assembly. Court of Appeals.

docs.lead_paragraph: The great business in the House this morning was the reception of reports-under which I should think more than a hundred bills were sent to the Committee of the Whole-doubtless many of them to be taken therefrom by the " wheel within the wheel "--the Select Committee of nine.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of New-York Daily Times

headline.main: VICTOR HUGO TO THE EXILES OF EUROPE.; His Speech on the Anniversary of the French Revolution of 1848. Translated from proof slips from the Author for the New-York Daily Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: EXILES: Had the Revolution, inaugurated on this day seven years ago, at the Hotel de Ville of Paris, followed its natural course, and had it not been, so to speak, turned aside from its great aim, on the very morrow of its advent;

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; What Shall be Done with the Crystal Palace? Board of Ten Governors. Five Points Hose of Industry-Doings in February. Slaughter-Houses--Committee on Public Health. Open Hatchways-Fatal Results. The Sixth-avenue Poison Case. Family Markets. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Decisions in Admiralty. Important to Warehousemen who have Hoistways.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Crystal Palace, like the elephant which the French gentleman won in a raflle, is a bad thing to get rid of. We see a circular going the rounds of the City, addressed to the Honorable the Common Council, praying that the property be purchased by the Corporation, for the purposes of a Central Distributing Market.
